introduction: The following passage is adapted from The Emperor of All Maladies: A Biography of Cancer by Siddhartha Mukherjee (2010).
text: Mukherjee recounts the history of cancer research, detailing critical discoveries that have shaped modern medicine. The identification of oncogenes, genes that can trigger cancer when mutated, ______ scientists to develop targeted therapies, marking a turning point in the fight against cancer.
question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English? Consider verb tense consistency, subject-verb agreement, and the logical relationship of the sentence to the historical and scientific context.
explanation: Choice C is the best answer. The present perfect has allowed bridges the historical discovery of oncogenes with its ongoing influence on modern cancer therapies, emphasizing its lasting relevance. Choice A is incorrect because allowing does not form a complete verb, leaving the sentence incomplete. Choice B is incorrect because allows incorrectly implies the action is happening currently, disrupting the historical context. Choice D is incorrect because allowed confines the action to the past, failing to highlight its continued importance.
